item.title: Leveraging AI as a Software Engineer: What Actually Works
item.description:
I have been using AI coding assistants seriously for about a year. Not casually, not experimentally: as a core part of how I do my job every day. I work across a wide surface area, writing Go and Python, managing cloud infrastructure, debugging distributed systems, automating operational workflows. AI has changed how I approach all of it, but not in the ways the marketing copy says.

This is not a post about AI generating code. It is about how AI changes the way an experienced engineer thinks, investigates, and makes decisions.

item.title: Building an AI-Powered Platform Operations Agent
item.description:
Building an AI-Powered Platform Operations Agent
#

Platform engineering teams handle a constant stream of repetitive requests: onboarding users, managing API keys, checking service health, rotating credentials. Most of these tasks follow well-defined procedures that a human executes step by step. What if an AI agent could handle them instead?

In this post, I’ll walk through the architecture of an AI-powered operations agent that automates common platform tasks by giving an LLM access to your internal tools through a structured tool-calling interface.
